thread.title: Newegg and InPost Canada hatch new partnership to use e-commerce parcel lockers for easy shipping and pick-up
thread.title_full: Newegg and InPost Canada hatch new partnership to use e-commerce parcel lockers for easy shipping and pick-up - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Newegg and InPost Canada hatch new partnership to use e-commerce parcel lockers for easy shipping and pick-up
text:
InPost Canada Inc
TORONTO , Oct. 20, 2015 /CNW/ - Newegg Canada is now offering delivery via the InPost Lockers 24/7 automated-parcel machine network. The service provides e-commerce shoppers the option to ship online purchases directly to one of 60 convenient InPost pick-up locations in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). The InPost network ( www.inpost24.ca ) will be expanding to 200 GTA locations by year end and 1,000 locations across Canada in 2016.
Newegg customers can now enjoy the ultimate flexibility to pick up their items when and where they want – InPost lockers are accessible 24/7 and the self-serve pick-up process takes under 10 seconds to complete. In addition, shipping directly to an InPost locker is a more efficient delivery method for Newegg, offering significant savings over home delivery.
Kunal Thakkar , Senior Vice President of Operations at Newegg says, "Newegg is constantly innovating to improve our customer experience while continuing to offer market-leading value, selection and service. Giving Newegg customers the option to pick up at an InPost locker aligns with our vision and will continue to differentiate our service from other e-retailers."
Convenient delivery options are key to accelerating e-commerce sales in Canada . Studies show half of households are unattended during working hours and over 40% of consumers are more likely to shop online when locker delivery is available.* To address this demand, Newegg now makes a subset of its products available for pick-up at InPost Lockers, with much broader product availability expected in 2016.
"Our automated parcel machines are becoming an irreplaceable form of easy and quick delivery of items for all Canadian e-shoppers,'' says InPost Canada CEO Tony Jasinski . "We are delighted to be partnering with Newegg, an e-commerce leader dedicated to ensuring everyone's shopping and customer-service expectations are surpassed."
InPost plans to roll out 1,000 locations nationally in 2016 under site agreements with major retailers, grocery outlets and gas stations.
About InPost Worldwide
The InPost parcel-locker network is the largest international network of automatic machines making it easy to send and receive parcels 24/7. The terminals are located in convenient locations. This customized solution is already present in more than a dozen countries, such as: Saudi Arabia , Australia , Chile , Great Britain , Ireland , Iceland , Italy , Latvia , Lithuania , Ukraine , Estonia , Poland , Russia , Cyprus , Slovakia , the Czech Republic as well as Columbia. Currently, there are more than 3,500 parcel lockers based on InPost's technology located worldwide.
About Newegg Inc.
Newegg Inc. is the leading electronics-focused e-retailer in the United States . It owns and operates Newegg.com ( www.newegg.com ) which was founded in 2001 and regularly earns industry-leading customer service ratings. The award-winning website has more than 25 million registered users and offers customers a comprehensive selection of the latest consumer electronics products, detailed product descriptions and images, as well as how-to information and customer reviews. Newegg Inc. is headquartered in City of Industry, California .
*IMRG Consumer Home Delivery Review 2014, Market research 2014, InPost Lockers Australia
